labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.16-9 **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @AHowell14 **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770837585394609) ## Action Performed: 1. Log into New Expensify on Web as a report approver who does not have the business bank account connected in their Wallet 2. From the left-hand navigation, click on Home 3. Observe the To Do section: note the “Pay X reports” task 4. Click on Reports 5. Under the To Do tab/list, observe that “Pay X reports” is also displayed ## Expected Result: If the user does not have the relevant business bank account connected in their Wallet (and therefore cannot pay workspace reports), they should not see a “Pay X reports” task. ## Actual Result: The approver sees a “Pay X reports” task on both the Home page and the Reports To Do section, despite not having the business bank account in their Wallet. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos The screenshot for the issue is in Slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770837585394609) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Reproduction blocked) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @AndrewGable **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Quality](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1770832351753919) ## Action Performed: 1. Have an active workspace with a billing balance due 2. Delete the workspace without clearing the balance 3. Attempt to close the account 4. Observe the error message indicating money is owed 5. Attempt to locate billing to clear the balance ## Expected Result: When a user attempts to delete their last workspace while an outstanding balance exists: A “Pay and downgrade” prompt should appear clearly explaining: There is an outstanding balance that must be paid before deleting the workspace. The exact amount owed. ## Actual Result: Account closure is blocked due to unpaid balance. Billing UI is not accessible because there are no active workspaces.User has no visible way to resolve the outstanding amount. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.17-6 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @puneetlath **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Migrate](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1770828722723789) ## Action Performed: 1. Enable Approvals in a workspace 2. Enable Prevent self-approvals 3. Turn Approvals OFF 4. Attempt to submit a report to yourself 5. Review workspace settings for Prevent self-approvals ## Expected Result: When Approvals are disabled: The “Prevent self-approvals” setting should automatically be: Disabled No “Oops, you’re submitting to yourself” warning should appear. Self-submission should proceed normally since no approval flow exists. ## Actual Result: The “Prevent self-approvals” setting remains locked ON. The system still shows: “Oops, you’re submitting to yourself” Even though Approvals are turned off. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/78d681e4-7ce4-454b-9b76-fde05261b96e https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/66526bda-b105-4277-af29-0857b866f18e [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.10-6 **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @nicollyrodrigues-max **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770830652213539) ## Action Performed: 1. Navigate to Account > Profile. 2. Click on Add contact method. 3. Add a new email address. 4. Verify the new email address. 5. Return to Account > Profile and open the newly added contact method. 6. Attempt to set the new email as the default contact method. ## Expected Result: After adding and verifying the new email, the system should display a “Set as default” option, allowing the user to select the new email as the default contact method. ## Actual Result: The system does not display any option to set the new email as the default contact method. No action button (such as “Set as default”) is available. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Go to https://staging.new.expensify.com/ 2. Create an expense in the WS, set the merchant as 'Starbucks'. 3. Navigate to Workspaces > [Current workspace] > Rules 4. Scroll down to Merchant feature, then click on 'if merchant containts "Starbucks"' 5. Press Ctrl + D, toggle on Force offline ## Expected Result: Preview matches should correctly display cached data. ## Actual Result: Preview matches do not display cached data. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d4c1b7fc-ccfa-444f-ac19-48c2dfb86146 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Paid reports filter in New Expensify only shows admin’s own reports, not all workspace reports

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @rairibeiro **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770668826587829) ## Action Performed: 1. Log into New Expensify as a workspace admin 2. Go to the Reports page 3. Select the workspace from filter pill 4. Apply filters to show Paid reports, and (optionally) specify a date range 5. Observe the list of results 6. In Expensify Classic, apply the same workspace and date filters for Paid reports and compare the results. ## Expected Result: In New Expensify, the Paid reports filter for a workspace should return all Paid reports for all users in that workspace, matching what the admin can see in Expensify Classic. Admins should be able to filter by workspace and dates and see all relevant reports for that workspace. ## Actual Result: In New Expensify, the admin sees only their own Paid reports under the workspace, even though they can see all employees’ Paid reports in Expensify Classic using the same filters. The same workspace and date filters produce different visibility results between Classic and New Expensify. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos The video for the issue is in Slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770668826587829) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.17-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @Christinadobrzyn **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Migrate](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1770752577109479) ## Action Performed: 1. Sign into New Expensify (ND) 2. Navigate to Reports > Reports 3. Click on Columns filter 4. Enable the Export column 5. Save the change and confirm that the Export column now appears on the Reports page 6. Navigate to another page, e.g., Settlements or Expenses 7. Navigate back to the Reports page ## Expected Result: The Export column (and any other custom columns added) remains visible on the Reports page after navigating away and back. Column selections for the Reports page are persisted across navigation and sessions. ## Actual Result: The Export column disappears after navigating to another page and returning to Reports. Custom column configuration is not saved, requiring the user to re-add the column each time. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c69dd21e-a3ef-4696-88ae-39fc5c538372 https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d0f232b9-371d-4838-82cd-0fa264a28533 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.3.15-10 **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @marianaabussamra **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770749510493419) ## Action Performed: 1. Log in as a workspace admin 2. Ensure there are existing distance expenses created under an older distance rate, on reports that are already Approved and Exported 3. Create a new distance rate for the workspace (or update the existing one) 4. Open previously approved and exported reports containing distance expenses and inspect the distance line items ## Expected Result: Distance expenses on reports that were already Approved and Exported should remain calculated with the original rate used at the time of approval/export, preserving historical reimbursement amounts. ## Actual Result: All historical distance expenses are recalculated to use the new distance rate, including those on Approved and Exported reports. Previously approved/exported reports display updated (changed) distance amounts, so historical mileage reimbursement values are not preserved. Opening the expenses display an error it doesn't match the calculation. The exported report in QBO displays the correct (Old) rate ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos The screenshots for the issue are in slack [thread](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1770749510493419) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] From `Home`, take member to the report directly vs reports page, depending on number of reports

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
In order to avoid an extra click for the one report case, while still giving approvers the ability to pick and choose specific reports to approve in the case of many reports, we'll update the behavior of the `Begin` button on the `Home` page. The product spec is: - This behavior is specific to the `Home` page - The `Begin` button can appear for the submit/approve/pay/export report actions - When there is only one report, `Begin` will take the user directly to the report thread - On desktop, this means the user will see the "super wide" report modal - On mobile, this means the user will see the full screen report - When there is more than one report, `Begin` will take the user to the relevant filter, where they're able to pick the first report they action on. The relevant pages are: - Reports > To-do > Submit - Reports > To-do > Approve - Reports > To-do > Pay - Reports > To-do > Export
